title: Bill Murray says he applied to work at chinese bistro P.F Chang's at the Atlanta airport
text:
Bill Murray just revealed one of his dream jobs.

While on Amy Schumer's podcast 3 Girls, 1 Keith, the 69-year-old comedian shared the one job he submitted his application for.

'I did fill out an application at P.F. Chang's at the Atlanta airport, because I think that's one of the great places,' he said during the interview with the I Feel Pretty star.

He's hired! Bill Murray just revealed one of his dream jobs is to work at the Chinese restaurant P.F. Changs

Amy appeared to be shocked by the answer and had a couple questions for the ground-breaking comedian.

'To do what? Just any job?' she asked him.

'It looks like the best time,' he responded. And while P.F Changs may have missed his application, they responded in a broader way by offering him a job on Twitter.

Sounds like fun! 'It looks like the best time,' he responded to Amy while on the podcast

'Bill, you're hired!' the company tweeted. 'When can you start?'

While Bill may not need to pick up the extra hours with his resume full of once-in-a-lifetime gigs such as Saturday Night Live, Garfield, Zombieland, and more.

He's also booked solid for the remainder of the year and into 2020 with his new movies Ghostbusters, The French Dispatch, and On the Rocks.

Busy man: He's also booked solid for the remainder of the year and into 2020 with his new movies Ghostbusters, The French Dispatch, and On the Rocks. He's pictured above at the red carpet for the Rome Film Festival

Recently, the star was honored during the 2019 Rome Film Festival earlier this month while in Italy.

'I show up for Bill because he shows up for me,' Frances McDormand said while attending for his friend.

'But he can hurt you, literally. He once threw me over his shoulder and cracked my ribs. He didn't mean to. He eventually put me down, but he has never let me down.'

The two go way back and starred in the movie Moonrise Kingdom.
